Dear Mr. Weaver:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced facility completed on
03/03/2021. Due to the violations, a written corrective action plan is required. It should
be noted that violations of any licensing statutes rules and are also violations of the
MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
 Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
 For repeat violations note why the previous CAP was unsuccessful.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, a regular certificate of approval
license will be issued. If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan,
disciplinary action will result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes except for the
following:
R 400.4113 Employee records.
An institution shall maintain employee records for each
employee and shall include documentation of all of the following
information prior to employment or at the time specified in this
rule:
(e) Three dated references which are obtained prior to
employment from persons unrelated to the employee and which
are less than 12 months old.
(i) Documentation from the Michigan department of human
services, the equivalent state or Canadian provincial agency, or
equivalent agency in the country where the person usually
resides, that the person has not been determined to be a
perpetrator of child abuse or child neglect. The documentation
shall be completed not more than 30 days prior to the start of
employment and every 12 months thereafter.
(e) One of 13 new employee files reviewed contained references that were dated
after the employee was hired.
(i) Two of 13 new employee files reviewed contained central registry clearances for
child abuse/neglect that were not completed according to the rule. One was
completed after the employee’s hire. The other contained a clearance dated more
than 30 days prior to hire and a second clearance completed after hire.
R 400.4154 Shelter care and detention institutions; service plans.
(1) Within 30 calendar days after admission and every 15
calendar days thereafter, an institution shall complete a written
service plan. The service plan shall include all of the following:
(a) The reason for continued care.
(b) Evaluation of service needs.
(c) Ongoing service needs.
(d) How service needs will be met.
(e) Unmet service needs and the reasons those needs are
unmet.
4

Two of two short term detention files reviewed contained 30-day service plans that
were completed late. The facility used the date after the 7-day plan was completed
and not the admission date as noted in the rule.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there are
additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1.
The facility does not take DHHS youth, so MISEP is not applicable.
3.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also a DHHS Contract/Policy violation. Please note
that there are additional DHHS Contract/Policy requirements that may not be included
in section 1.
The facility is not contracted with DHHS; therefore, no contract or policy requirements
apply.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
R 154(1)(b)
The facility was advised to ensure they are not copying and pasting information from
one detention service plan to the next. Each is to be a review of the period and
updated accordingly.
R 166
The facility was advised to ensure they include all services provided, on the open
treatment unit discharge summaries, and not limit that to medical and dental.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
R 113
The facility is asked to provide some organization to the employee files so that
information is separated into sections. At this time, all documents are in one open file
so the entire file must be reviewed to find each necessary requirement during an
inspection.
5

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care or substantiated
corporal punishment during this licensing period.
The facility has not been required to submit any corrective action plans this licensing
period.
There have been no special investigations during this period. The facility has
demonstrated efforts to comply with the new restraint rules by reporting the one
restraint they have done. It appears they are making efforts to comply with licensing
rules.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the facility will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
